project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching a group of issues in *Issues > Search for issues* - if the list spans multiple pages, *Tools > Bulk Change > current page* will always choose the results from the first page, regardless of the page you have navigated to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to  *Issues > Search for issues*
# Perform a JQL search that returns more than 1 page of results
# Switch to a page, other than page 1, of the results
# Attempt to perform a bulk change on the page you are on using *Tools > Bulk Change > current page*

h3. Expected Results

The bulk operation will be performed on the page you were viewing when selecting *current page*.

h3. Actual Results

The list of issues will always be of the first page.

h3. This was reproducible on a test instance of Jira 7.10.0, as well as on JAC itself.

h3. Workaround

Explicitly search for the issues that would have been on that page.
fields.summary: Bulk Editor > Current page always uses the Page 1 results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
[Project Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira060/configuring-project-links-across-applications-370705798.html] used to be popular in old versions of JIRA and Applinks plugin. But in modern versions, it has become redundant/obsolete in a sense that it doesn't add much value to Applinks related features.

h3. Suggestion
There have been a few suggestions on improving Applinks related features:
* [More Permission Options for Development Tools|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38315]
* [Disable or limit the "Create Branch" option|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14931]
* [Display Name together with Type when linking JIRA to multiple applications of the same type|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41137]

This ticket suggests that Project Links be improved to become more useful/powerful for Applinks related features, in a sense that it can help achieve one or more of the above suggestions. For example:
* If JIRA is integrated with 2 Bitbucket instances
* JIRA Project A is linked with Bitbucket Project B
* A JIRA user tries to create a branch from JIRA issue A-1
* JIRA should understand that the branch is to be created in Bitbucket Project B
fields.summary: Make Project Links more useful/powerful for Applinks related features

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using _Days in Column_ for boards slows down page loading due to extra Lucene computation. 
Please check KB article for details: [Kanban board loading is slow - performance problems|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Kanban+board+loading+is+slow+-+performance+problems]

Currently, you can switch it off manually for each board configuration, but it requires a lot of work and not very scalable. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Please, give a possibility to switch it off globally.
fields.summary: Give an ability to disable days in column globally

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have shared service team Scrum boards.  Our teams can be assigned issues from ANY project, and the board filters use a custom field (Team - this is a single-select dropdown) to pull in issues.

We have a user group, let's call it Sprint Managers, and all the folks who should be able to create, edit, start, and stop sprints are assigned to this user group.

Our projects are assigned to one of five different permission schemas.  In every single one of those schemas, the Sprint Managers user group is assigned Project Admin and Manage Sprints permissions.  Therefore, all users who are assigned to that user group should be able to manage sprints in any Scrum board.

This worked just fine in version 6.4, but we upgraded to version 7.8 a few weeks ago, and now none of the people in the Sprint Managers group has the ability to manage sprints in any of the boards that have "complex filters" (in other words, not specifying a list of projects within the filter, but instead pulling in issues from any project based on the Team custom field).

In order to get around this, I have had to assign Sprint Managers to the jira-administrators group.  I should not have to make someone an administrator just to be able to manage sprints.  

Suggestion: create a separate standard Jira user group for "jira-sprint-managers" and give them the same sprint management capability as the jira-administrators group, without giving them all the other administration capabilities.
fields.summary: Sprints on boards with complex filters can only be managed by JIRA administrators

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In a large Jira Software (Agile) instance (more than 4000000 issues) using the the {{not in}} clause to avoid querying one or a few projects among thousands will trigger a Lucene query that will search for an Agile custom field {{in openSprints()}} making the query to take a long time to complete.

If the JQL is used as a filter in a board, it will cause the board to time out.

Enabling DEBUG logging for Lucene queries will show a JQL similar to:

{code}
{FIRST PART OF THE JQL} AND {project not in ("PROJECT NAME")} AND {status in (A VERY LONG LIST HERE)} AND ( {CUSTOM FIELD in openSprints()} OR NOT {SECOND PART OF THE JQL} order by Rank ASC
{code}


h2. Environment

* Jira Software 7.2.13 

* Jira instance with a large number of issues and comments (more than 4000000 issues)


h2. Expected Results

The JQL returns the results in an acceptable time not making boards to time out.


h3. Actual Results
 
The JQL takes a long time and causes boards to time out.

h2.Workaround

Avoid using the {{not in}} clause.
fields.summary: JQL using {not in} clause triggers a lucene search that makes the operation to take a long time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Loading "_Boards in this project_" while rendering the sidebar Jira executes the {{findRapidViewsByProject}}, which degrades under load with a large number of boards (see JSWSERVER-16130). 
Sidebar screenshot: 
 !Agile_Boards.png|thumbnail! 
this leads to a slow issue loading. In some situations, this data is not necessary and Jira users would prefer speed over functionality. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to disable the "_Boards in this project_" functionality to improve issue loading performance. 

h3. New feature
For Jira mentioned in _Fix Version_:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On an agile board that's based on a saved filter, if the filter query contains '&' character, the part of the query including and after & character is omitted when you click on "Looking for an older issue?" link, hence the query is malformed and causes an error.
h3. Environment

Jira Software 7.9.2 and 7.11.0 (these versions tested)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 7.9.2/7.11.0
 # Create an new Kanban software development project BUGTRACK, with key BUGTRACK
 # Create an issue, Summary: Test, Labels: Charlie&Angels
 # Create a filter, Name: Filter1, JQL: {{labels in ("Charlie&Angels")}}
 !filter.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a Kanban board, Name: Board1, selecting create Board from an existing Saved Filter, and select Filter1 as the filter
 # Open Board1, click on "Looking for an older issue?" link on Done column
 !looking_for_an_older_issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

a query results view with JQL (this JQL is indicated when you hover above the older issues link)

{\{labels in ("Charlie&Angels") AND (fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY) AND status = "10002" AND NOT (updated >= -2w OR statusCategory != Done) }}
h4. Actual Results

a query results view with JQL 

 {{labels in ("Charlie}}

And error message 
 Error in the JQL Query: The quoted string 'Charlie' has not been completed. (line 1, character 12)
 !error_message.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The field need not be Label, any other field with a text content (i.e.) component can be used to generate same effect.

i.e.
 # add a component 'Research & Development' to BUGTRACK project
 # Edit BUGTRACK-1 issue previously created, select "Research & Development" as component and save
 # Create a filter for JQL component = "Research & Development", and a Kanban board based on this filter.
 Error is the same, JQL is trimmed from '&' character again as below

{{component = "Research}}
 Error in the JQL Query: The quoted string 'Research ' has not been completed. (line 1, character 13)
 (Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

replacing '&' character with 'and', so that no & character exists in text component
fields.summary: "Looking for an older issue?" function in agile boards cuts off query after a "&"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If multiple transitions happen in same second, burndown chart will treat them all as a single transition with mix of "from" and "to" statuses from "component" transactions.

This transition's "from" status will be one of "from" statuses of "component" transitions selected from column most to the right possible.

This transition's "to" status will be one of "to" statuses of "component" transitions selected from column most to the right possible.

Both "from" and "to" statuses can be picked from different "component" transisions.

This means that in some cases transition from "To do"/"In progress" to "Done" can be missed and not shown on burndown chart.

h4. Example:
2 columns on board:
 # Column 1 statuses:
 ## To do
 # Column 2 statuses:
 ## Done
 ## Released 

Transitioning issue: "To do" -> "Done" -> "Released"
 Can be treated by burndown chart as single transition: "Done" -> "Released"

h3. Steps to reproduce

h5. Import dataset: 
[^burndown-chart-in-one-sec.zip] (exported from Jira 7.2.0; user: admin/admin)
Access boards under:
# <Jira>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=reporting&chart=burndownChart&sprint=1
# <Jira>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=reporting&chart=burndownChart&sprint=1

*OR*
 
h5. Setup from vanilla instance:

# Create project with 2 scrum boards based on it.
# Add "Released" status and assign it to "Done" column for both boards.
# Assign "Done" status to "In progress" column only for 1st board.
# For the project
## Create sprint.
## Add one issue to it.
## Estimate the issue.
## Start the sprint.
# Make 2 transitions of the issue to "Done" and "Released" in a single second.
** _You can use JVM debugger to stop Jira before doing both operations at once and release the debugger afterwards. This should make them in less then 1 second. To verify if it worked you can check times in "changegroup" table in Jira database. Look for same times in last rows of "created" column._
# Complete the sprint

h4. Expected result
Burndown charts for both boards show the same results as the single issue started in "To do" status and finished in "Released" which for both boards was assigned to "Done" column.

h4. Actual result
Burndown chart for 1st board is correct (as expected).
Burndown chart for 2nd board shows no issues resolved, because it merged both transitions into one that leads from "Done" to "Released" status.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: Burndown chart can miss issue transition if multiple transitions were made in 1 second

fields.description:
Use case 1: As Elon Musk, I do not want my board or the press to become aware that I deployed a super-secret task force to work on a project to build an autonomous hovercraft, codename "Floaty Car." Therefore, I cannot have the whole company seeing the names of epics in the FC project. Unfortunately, even though I love love LOVE Jira software, I cannot use Jira for my FC project. Floaty fail.

Use case 2: As a consultant with multiple clients, each with their own projects but in the same, highly-competitive industry, I cannot have clients seeing the names of epics that we are working on for other clients. This creates a major security issue for me, and even though I love love LOVE Jira software (wow, I sound like Elon Musk!) alas, I cannot use Jira for my projects. In addition to the security issue, clients often accidentally assign stories to epics in other projects, which creates a mess for everyone. 

For both use cases, the 100+ commenters, 157 watchers in JSWSERVER-12016 and I disagree with the Jira's comment in JSWSERVER-12016 that, "there are no known security issues with the epic link field, if a user does not have view permissions for a project then they will not see the epics for that project." True, a user may not be able to see the details of an epic itself, but the user _*can see the names*_ of the epics in other projects, which is the issue.

I am marking this story symptom severity as "critical" because this issue prevents many of us from using Jira software for projects on which we would like to use it.

Thank you,
Will
fields.summary: Prohibit Jira users from seeing the names of Epics in other projects, such as in the Epic Link field results

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Starting from [JIRA 7.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-2-x-release-notes-826896227.html], there's a new feature in JIRA - "Smart mentions" which will bring the people already involved in conversation to the top of the list _even_ if the user being mentioned does not have "Browse Project" permission. An example of such user is a Reporter or Assignee (consider a person moved to another project and no longer involved with the current project)

This had worked differently in JIRA prior to version 7.2 where users would only be able to mention users who have "Browse projects" permission regardless of whether the user being mentioned is involved on the ticket or not.

The ability to mention users _without_ "Browse Project" permission creates a confusion where a user who is mentioning someone else on the ticket is expecting that an [email notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html] will be sent to the user being mentioned, however, since the user does not have "Browse Project" permission – JIRA will not send a notification to that user (by design)

This feature request is to improve handling this situation, either by restricting mentions only to users with "Browse projects" permission – or by adding a notification to at the time of mentioning such a user that they will not receive a notification as they are no longer involved in the project
fields.summary: Restrict mentions only to users with "Browse projects" permission

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when issues from the Kanban Backlog are right-clicked and moved to the first status on the board, then Jira Software will not only transition it, but will also update the rank of the issue so that this has the lower rank value and appears at the bottom of the list. 

However, if you try to transition this issue from the Jira Issue view instead, example, 'backlog' status to 'Ready For Development' status, then Jira, as usually, will only transition the issue and will not also update the rank value of the issue like Jira Software. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Kanban board issues when transitions from the backlog statuses to the board status to also have the functionality to update the rank fields too to a lower value relative to the board so they appear on the bottom.
fields.summary: As a user, I want Rank to be updated when moved to the Kanban board from the backlog so that it has the least value when transitioning from the Jira Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior

When an IOException is encountered during reindexing or restoring an index, Jira is able to retry the operation a few times before failing.
h3. Actual Behavior

If an IOException is being thrown, e.g. because a file is being locked by another process, the reindex/index restore stops, which usually results in a corrupted index.
This usually happens due to a running anti-virus or due to [JDK-4724038|https://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=4724038] bug on Windows.
The problem can manifest itself with an exception like this:
{code:java}
2018-07-10 22:58:51,518 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index restore started. Snapshot file: IndexSnapshot_16400.zip
2018-07-10 22:59:03,221 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Restoring search indexes - 1% complete... Replacing indexes
2018-07-10 22:59:03,486 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] Error re-indexing node changes
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: D:\Atlassian\JIRA\caches\indexes\issues\_9j.cfs
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:377)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy19.withReindexLock(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:293)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: D:\Atlassian\JIRA\caches\indexes\issues\_9j.cfs
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.forceDelete(FileUtils.java:1919)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.cleanDirectory(FileUtils.java:1399)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.deleteDirectory(FileUtils.java:1331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.replaceIndexes(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:407)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:342)
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Lock one of the Lucene's files inside Jira home and start a reindex.
h3. Workaround

Exclude Jira home directory from anti-virus scans.
If the problem is a result of the JVM bug, there is no known workaround for this at the moment.
fields.summary: Improve IOException handling during reindexing and restoring an index

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 It appears Jira Software loses viability on an issue's change history when a previously existing status is removed ( changed ) from the project's workflow. This affects the historical reporting on the various agile charts for the affected project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a workflow with the following statuses
 ## Open -> In Progress -> Resolved -> Closed
 # Create a sprint, add an issue from the backlog, transition every step from Open until Closed, and complete the sprint
 # Create new workflow with the following statuses
 ## Open -> In Progress -> Status 9
 # Migrate workflow, map issues in Resolved and Closed to Status 9

h3. Expected Results

Agile reports are unaffected by this change
h3. Actual Results

Sprint report show issues moved from Resolved and Closed to Status 9 as being In Progress and Removed From Sprint. Cycle Time is also incorrectly calculated for these issues as well. See attached screenshots.

Issue history:
 !issue-history.png|thumbnail!

Sprint report:
 !sprint-report-bad.png|thumbnail!

Notice how the Sprint report shows issue 1 as Open instead of Status 9
h3. Notes

Other Agile reports may be affected from this change.
 While the original report comes from Jira 6.4 / Jira Agile 6.7 we reproduced this problem in Jira 7.11 too.

This can affect any status on the far right or far left for example if you leave out a to do status from the old workflow, the sprint report will not see that the issues were ever "started" and it will negatively affect burndown
h3. Workaround

Modify the affect project's workflow, add changed status back, and map this status to a column in the project's agile board(respective to their position in the old board i.e. far right or far left) They do not need transitions to or from other statuses. In the example above Agile reporting is fixed by adding Resolved and Closed back to the affected project's workflow and mapping the statuses to the Done column accordingly. See attached screenshot.

!sprint-report-fixed.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Migrating workflows on existing projects can impact Agile reporting if statuses are changed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5.Scenario
# One project, with two issues in it. Each issue has a different label (call them {{A}} and {{B}})
# Create a board for the project, and adjust the filter to include issues that have a Label of {{A}}
# Create a second board for the project, and adjust the filter to include issues that have a Label of {{B}}
# Each board should have 1 issue per board.

h5.Steps to reproduce
# On the same issue as the sprint was created from, add the issue on that board to the sprint
# The sprint is only shown on this board - it's not shown on the other board.
# On the second board, visit the issue and change it's sprint manually

h5.Results
The sprint appears in both boards (which is the correct behaviour). However, this might be confusing. It might be helpful to include a question mark in the header for each sprint that doesn't belong to this board -  "Why am I seeing this board?"

Jira knows which sprints belong to a given board - the {{AO_60DB71_SPRINT.RAPID_VIEW_ID}} column refers to the board it was created from (but it's not a limiting factor in displaying boards).

It would also be nice to have a feature to toggle this behaviour at an appropriate level (system wide, a per project setting, or an additional filter at the board level) that would show "Only this board's sprints" or similar.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA DVCS plugin fails to connect to github.com if JIRA is accessing public internet through a forward proxy that uses basic authentication.


h3. Environment
* JIRA Software with DVCS plugin  
* Configure a forward proxy using basic proxy authentication: eg: squid or apache
* Configure JIRA to use a forward proxy using following start up options:
{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=127.0.0.1 -Dhttp.proxyPort=3128 -Dhttp.proxyUser=user -Dhttp.proxyPassword=pass -Dhttps.proxyHost=127.0.0.1 -Dhttps.proxyPort=3128 -Dhttps.proxyUser=user -Dhttps.proxyPassword=pass  -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# After a freshly restarted JIRA
# Login to JIRA as admin
# Go to Applications and try to configure DVCS to connect to github

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA is able to connect to github and verify the user account.

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA fails to connect to github and user is faced with a connection/access error.
* In the logs we see warnings like this:
{code}
2018-05-24 11:27:15,178 http-nio2-13032-exec-44 WARN admin 687x111223x1 1q8lhhh IP,IP,IP /secure/admin/AddGithubOrganization!finish.jspa [c.a.j.p.d.s.github.webwork.AddGithubOrganization] Caused by: Unable to tunnel through proxy. Proxy returns "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required"
{code}
* Jira doesn't send authenticaion header to proxy, this header is missing:
{noformat}
Proxy-authorization: Basic dXNlcjp1c2Vy
{noformat}

 
h3. Notes
Please check the related bug for JIRA Core: JRASERVER-67487


h3.Workaround
Please check the related bug for JIRA Core: JRASERVER-67487
fields.summary: DVCS plugin is not able to connect to github.com if it runs behind a forward proxy with basic authentication enabled

fields.description:
Hello,

 

We look at your recommendation for the base Systems.


The databases which you show in your compatibility list are old for Oracle, MSSQL and Postgres for example.


Databases are very important for the complete system. Why don't you use the current standards for performance and high availability.


I am fan of your products for several years.
From user perspectice your products are innovative and are so close on real life.
Please come closer to the current releases.

We have several vendors for erp, crm, etc.
Most of them are close to current releases for database and other components.
Some of them have automated test for that.

If I do some comparison then we have to update your releases each year or we use the long term version then we have 2 years.
The long term release is an old one.
So from your side you put pressure on the costumer for the current releases.
We have to focus the complete chain for a supported system.
For an old system that's nearly impossible, because you have Bugs, fixes and Update on all Levels, from Hardware, driver, OS up to the application.
You support several databases, that's great. So you are relatively close to the ANSI Standard for databases.
So you have nearly no functional issues on database release changes, you have to expect performance changes in other query handling.
Please regard some special functions on the different database products.
For example on SQL Server you have the compatibility mode for those challenges.
That means you install an SQL Server 2017, but you can change the compatibility mode for each database, to the supported Release/Mode.
So you can run in SQL Server 2016 Mode, but 2017 is installed.
Microsoft has explicit this feature for these situations.
These functions are also available in ORACLE or postgresql for example.
As far as I know are you working straight forward and don't do any tricks on databases servers.
If you support those setups you would take pressure of your supported equipment.

We're looking forward to you supporting the latest DB versions


Thanks in advance.
Kind regards

Reinhard
fields.summary: JSW supported databases

fields.description:
According to the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/configuring-issue-level-security-935391113.html), sub-tasks inherit the Security level of their parent issue. This is not true when the Security field is hidden in the sub-task Field Configuration. In that case, newly created sub-tasks have no security value, regardless of the parent issue Security value. However, if a top-level issue or sub-task is moved under the parent, the Security value of that sub-task will be set to that of the parent, and if the parent Security value is changed, all sub-tasks will be updated to match the parent Security value. This can lead to inconsistent sub-task security between one parent issue and another, or even between sub-tasks of the same parent. The sub-task Security values are not visible in the UI, because the Security field is hidden, so it takes an admin looking in the database to figure out why some sub-tasks are unprotected and others aren't. The most common case (sub-task not moved and parent security not changed) is that sub-tasks that are expected to be protected by issue security are exposed.

Un-hiding the Security field in the sub-task Field Configuration results in sub-tasks consistently following the parent security level, however this is a workaround. The documentation does not say that correct operation of sub-task security is dependent on the Field Configuration, and given the importance of issue security, it should not be.

A request for allowing sub-tasks to have different security levels than their parent (JRASERVER-5869) was rejected, however, when the security field is hidden in the sub-task Field Configuration, this bug essentially does just that (at least, it allows sub-tasks to have no security value when the parent has a value). Although if you're counting on it as a way to deliberately expose sub-tasks under protected parent issues, you'll occasionally be disappointed.

I understand that hiding a field in the Field Configuration is intended to prevent fields from being set (JRASERVER-15791), however that rule should not trump issue security, and it isn't even being applied consistently. The sub-task Security field is still set on certain events, such as moving an issue under a parent or updating the parent Security value, even when the Security field is hidden.

As stated in the documentation, sub-tasks should always have the same Security value as their parent, regardless of the sub-task Field Configuration setting for the Security field.

*To reproduce:*
1. Configure a project with a top-level issue type that has Security, and a sub-task issue type.
2. Configure a Security scheme with two values.
3. Hide the Security field in the sub-task Field Configuration (but not in the parent issue type Field Configuration).
4. Create a parent issue A1 with non-empty Security field.
5. Create a sub-task B1 under the parent issue.

* Query the database and see that the sub-task has no Security value although the parent has a value.

    6. Create a top-level issue A2 with no Security value.
    7. Convert A2 to a sub-task under the A1 parent issue. (Confirmation screen shows that Security will be set to the same value as the new parent issue.)
    Query the database and see that the A2 sub-task has the same Security value as the parent A1, while the first sub-task B1 still has no Security value.
    8. Change the A1 parent issue Security value to a different value.
    Query the database and see that both sub-tasks have been updated to match the new Security value of the parent issue.
    9. Un-hide the Security field in the sub-task Field Configuration and repeat steps 4-8 to see that with this change, sub-tasks always have the same Security value as their parent.

*Workaround:*
1. Unhide the Security field in the sub-task Field Configuration to get the sub-task Security field to be set correctly on creation. The Security field does not have to be added to Create or Edit screens. The Security field will be visible in bulk edit, but this does not allow users to change the Security value for a sub-task independently of the parent.
2. Change the Security field of affected parent issues to a different value (or None) and then back to the original value to reset all sub-tasks to the parent Security value.
fields.summary: Inconsistent sub-task security levels

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello team,

We have a request for a new feature to allow the scrum team to annotate the burndown chart on the X axis so that key events during the sprint can be recalled for later discussion e.g. during the sprint retrospective.

For example when an estimate is reduced after some revelation comes to light or when a pair of programmers worked together and got a lot of sprint backlog items done.

This information would encourage the team to consider how their decisions and actions during the sprint affect the burndown chart and their ability to get work done, especially for people who are new to scrum or for longer (3-4 week) sprints where not everything can be readily recalled during retrospectives.
fields.summary: Allow users to annotate the sprint burndown chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Plan Branch in Bamboo contains a JIRA Issue Key in its name, a Build from that Branch won't update the JIRA Issue's DevPanel overview if it's not directly linked with the JIRA Issue. Clicking the Build link from the DevPanel however shows this new Build's details.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create applinks between JIRA and Bamboo
# From Bamboo, create a new project -> create a new plan (with default job and tasks) -> link the plan with a repository that has a Branch containing a JIRA Issue Key in the Branch name
# From Plan Configuration -> Branches, manually create a new Plan Branch -> select the Branch with the JIRA issue key in its name  -> click Create
!1.planbranch.png|thumbnail!
# Go to the plan -> branch -> observe that:
#* It's linked with the JIRA issue
#* An initial build has been run successfully (default job and tasks)
!2.firstbuildsuccess.png|thumbnail!
# View the JIRA issue and observe that:
#* It's linked with the plan branch with a PASS icon
#* It's not linked with any build
!3.issuelink.png|thumbnail!
# Configure the plan's default job in a way that the next build will fail e.g. by adding a task ensuring that it will fail
# Trigger a commit from the linked repository's branch mentioning the JIRA issue key in the commit message
# Observe the failed build:
!4.secondbuildfail.png|thumbnail!
(+) This failed build has the JIRA issue *directly linked* with it thanks to the commit message
# Observe the failed build in the JIRA issue as well:
!5.issuebuildfail.png|thumbnail!
(+) Take note that the linked plan branch now displays a WARNING icon
# Click the Build link from the DevPanel -> observe the failed build:
!6.buildstatusfail.png|thumbnail!
# Configure the plan's default job again so that the next build will pass
# Go to the plan -> branch -> manually run the branch -> observe that:
#* The new build is successful
#* It's *not linked* with any JIRA issue
# View the JIRA issue and observe that:
#* The DevPanel still shows {{1 build failing}}
#* The plan branch now displays a PASS icon again
!7.newstatus.png|thumbnail!
#* Clicking the Build link from the DevPanel however shows the new successful build:
!8.buildstatuspass.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected behaviors
* As the new successful build is not linked with the JIRA issue key, clicking the Build link from the DevPanel shouldn't show it. This causes confusion because the DevPanel overview still shows the old failed build (which is expected because the failed build is linked with the JIRA issue)
* On the other hand, if clicking the Build link is expected to show the new successful build (probably because the plan branch itself is linked with the issue), then:
** This should be clearly documented as an expected behavior
** The DevPanel overview should display the new successful build as well
fields.summary: Manual Run of Plan Branch causes unexpected behaviors in JIRA Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira DC when upgrading board to Kanplan you can end up having clusterlocks. The lock is used only for disabling and enabling Kanplan for boards.

h3. Symptoms
Healthcheck reporting hangling cluster locks
{noformat}
Node '<node>' has been holding cluster lock, com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.view.BacklogColumnHelper-<id>
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Restarting nodes should remove the locks.
fields.summary: After migrating board to Kanplan some cluster locks can be left not released

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Recreating a Kanban/Scrum project with the same project key will cause it to reuse the old workflow.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a Scrum project with project key: AB, that will be supposed to create a new workflow.
 # Delete the project and recreate a Kanban project with the same project key: AB.

h3. *Expected Results*

The secondly-created Kanban project will have its own new Kanban workflow.
h3. *Actual Results*

The project uses back the old Scrum workflow instead.
h3. *Workaround*

[JIRA Software : Kanban / Scrum reuse the old workflow if the new project key is the same as the old project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-software-kanban-scrum-reuse-the-old-workflow-if-the-new-project-key-is-the-same-as-the-old-project-key-950823926.html].
fields.summary: Recreating a Kanban/Scrum project with the same project key will cause it to reuse the old workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira instance may have rank values that are later deleted. These fields may occur when updating from an older Jira version, or that a Rank field is manually created and associated to Jira Software. Users may want to delete these fields if not in use like if they are coming from an older Jira version, or due to performance related issues with having multiple rank fields. 

However, the problem is that the data with regards to these fields after the issue is cleared remains in the lexorank and the lexorankbalancer tables and there is no automated way to clear this from the UI. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a option in the UI to be able to automatically clean data from fields no longer in use.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like a feature to clean data related to rank fields no longer existent on the instance

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Versions view in project settings is using a single query to Jira's internal REST ({{GET /rest/projects/1.0/project/<KEY>/release/allversions}}) to gather all of the versions data. The query can be slow due to accessing index multiple times for each version.

The query can timeout in Jira's frontend resulting in versions list not being shown up.

h3. Environment
* Large Jira instance
** with large Lucene (a large number of issues 1M+)
** with project containing many issues with many versions (2000+)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access {{<jira>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<ProjectKey>/administer-versions}}
(replace {{<jira>}} with Jira's base URL and {{<ProjectKey>}} with large project's ID)

h3. Expected Results
Versions list loads. 

h3. Actual Results
Versions list request times out with the message:
{noformat}
The call to the JIRA server did not complete within the timeout period.
We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{noformat}

h3. Notes 
Slow loading of {{..release/allversions}} is caused by 2 factors 
* a large number of versions in the return list (in the project)
* a time required to calculate data for each version (4 Lucene calls are executed)


h3. Workaround
* There is no workaround so far. 
* You may want to use old version page with similar functionality: {{<jira>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJ>/versions}}

This is how the new page looks like:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-21 at 11.50.10.png|thumbnail! 
And how the old page looks like:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-21 at 11.50.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Versions view in Project settings can timeout on large instance
